title: La DANA deja ya más de 100 litros en la zona mallorquina de Ponent
text: Temporal La DANA deja ya más de 100 litros en la zona mallorquina de Ponent Desde Emergencias piden a la ciudadanía que extreme las precauciones Duna Márquez El temporal que [ha arrasado Valencia llega a Mallorca](/sociedad/2024/11/01/directo-ultima-hora-dana-azota-costa-mediterranea-sur-peninsula-110836403.html). Tras dejar precipitaciones intensas en Ibiza y Formentera, la DANA está descargando descargando con fuerza en parte de la isla.En la zona de Ponent se han registrado ya más de 100 litros por metro cuadrado. Las intensas lluvias, además, han provocado inundaciones importantes en Calvià, donde la crecida del torrent de Galatzò ha obligado además a cerrar al tráfico de un tramo de la Ma-101. Los municipios más afectados por las lluvias son, de momento, Galilea, Puigpunyent, Andratx y Calvià. Precisamente en este último, se han producido algunas inundaciones, cortes de calles y desprendimientos en carreteras, que han obligado a movilizar a Policía Local y efectivos municipales. El ayuntamiento de Calvià ha informado del corte al tráfico de un tramo de la Ma-101, la carretera de Calvià a es Capdellà, que se ha inundado por desbordamiento del torrente de Galatzó y de varias vías en Palmanova y Magaluf. La Policía Local y operarios municipales trabajan en las zonas afectadas. Se espera que en las próximas horas la dana se desplace por gran parte de Mallorca, dejando importantes precipitaciones a su paso. Más de 50 litros por metro cuadrado en una hora La Agencia Estatal de Meteorología recuerda que Mallorca se encuentra en alerta naranja por precipitaciones acumuladas de 50 litros por metro cuadrado en una hora, llegando a acumularse 120 litros por metro cuadrado en algunas zonas de la isla en pocas horas. Las lluvias se mantendrán hasta el sábado 2 de noviembre, alargándose el aviso naranja hasta primera hora de la mañana. Con el avance de las horas la alerta desaparecerá, pero las precipitaciones se mantendrán a lo largo del día. Parques, cementerios y pasos peatonales, cerrados El paso peatonal del paseo Marítimo de Palma entre el Palacio de Congresos y el Parc de la Mar permanece cerrado este viernes por el mal tiempo. Así lo ha informado el departamento de Carreteras del Consell de Mallorca en un mensaje en redes recogido por Europa Press. Cabe recordar que en Palma, desde las 14.00 horas de este viernes están cerrados los parques y los cementerios. El Govern pide "máxima prudencia" Ante la emergencia meteorológica para este día de Tots Sants, el Govern balear ha reclamado “máxima prudencia” a los ciudadanos “las próximas horas y días” por la alerta naranja decretada. Se recomienda que se tomen precauciones y mantenerse informado de la predicción meteorológica más actualizada. Las actividades habituales y al aire libre pueden verse alteradas. El Servicio de Emergencias 112 ha activado el Índice de Gravedad 1 (IG1) del Plan Meteobal por lluvias y tormentas en Mallorca y Menorca. El paso peatonal del paseo Marítimo de Palma entre el Palacio de Congresos y el Parc de la Mar permanece cerrado este viernes por el mal tiempo. Así lo ha informado el departamento de Carreteras del Consell de Mallorca en un mensaje en redes recogido por Europa Press. Cabe recordar que en Palma, desde las 14.00 horas de este viernes están cerrados los parques y los cementerios. title: Ayodhya Airport not just an aerodrome, it's also a Ramayana-inspired cultural spot
text:
Ayodhya Airport not just an aerodrome, it’s also a Ramayana-inspired cultural spot
The ‘Maharishi Valmiki International Airport Ayodhyadham’ in Uttar Pradesh’s Ayodhya is all set to be inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday, December 30. The aerodrome, besides catering to pilgrims and tourists, also has cultural significance as it is designed in line with the Hindu epic Ramayana.
Speaking to India Today TV, Vipul Varshney, the architect of the Ayodhya Airport, said that the structure is completely inspired by the life of the Hindu god Lord Ram. During the construction, it was specifically directed that it should be the only airport in the world that has a glimpse of the story of Lord Ram, Varshney noted.
The airport has been built in the Nagara architectural style, which is an Indian temple style popular in the country’s northern and western regions. The structure has seven mounted peaks (shikhara) — the main peak is in the middle, and three each at the front and back sides of the airport.
The seven shikharas are inspired by the seven books (Kandas) of Ramayana, and the sculptures and decorations on them have been done reflecting the same. Also, the airport has been designed in a way that allows a view of Lord Ram from any location.
A big mural of a bow and arrow has been installed outside the airport, signifying the victory over falsity, as explained by Varshney to India Today. Also, colours have been used in the landscaping of the airport, keeping in mind the five elements of nature — earth, water, fire, air, and space.
Two types of plaques in the murals have also been installed inside the airport — a divine plaque and a khandika. According to Varshney, an extensive study was conducted by meeting the saints and acharyas of Ayodhya, and the artists even studied the Skanda Purana (an ancient Hindu religious text) to prepare them.
One of the biggest murals in this airport is dedicated to Mahabali Hanuman, who was an ardent devotee of Lord Ram. This mural depicts Hanuman’s life from birth to his establishment in Ayodhya as per the orders of Lord Ram, according to folklore.
Apart from this, a massive Madhubani painting of the court of Lord Ram (Ram Darbar), as well as the depiction of his marriage to Sita also add to the cultural features of the airport.
Vipul Varshney also stated that the airport has been constructed with environmentally friendly GRC technology, which offers zero pollution caused by stones.
The first phase of the airport has been constructed at the cost of Rs 1,450 crore. The new terminal building, spanning 6,500 square meters, is designed to accommodate 600 peak-hour passengers, with an annual handling capacity of 10 lakh passengers.

title: 5G赋能 柳工制造提"智"升级
text:
柳工装载机智能工厂相关负责人接受记者采访。 广西云-广西日报记者刘俊聪/摄
柳工装载机智能工厂装配线。 唐幸/摄
扫一扫 更多精彩内容
实干第一线·新探访
广西云-广西日报记者 梁菁惠
项目介绍
广西柳工机械股份有限公司装载机智能工厂，通过“5G+工业互联网”融合实践，实现了“人、机、料、法、环”各要素的全面互联，在智能制造装备、产品模块化、生产柔性化等方面取得了显著进展。访工厂获评“2023第二届中国标杆智能工厂”，并入选工信部“2024年5G工厂名录”。
实干者说
广西柳工机械股份有限公司全球研发中心数字化研究院常务副院长孙帅：
我们将秉持创新精神，把握趋势，抢抓机遇，坚定实施“全面智能化”战略，深化5G应用，培育新质生产力，推动企业向“智”、向“新”、向“绿”发展，助力产业智能跃迁，为“中国智造”转型升级提供样本。
广西柳工机械股份有限公司装载机智能工厂区域生产高级经理邹广金：
我们将不断挖掘生产场景中的痛点需求，结合5G技术优势，攻克生产难点，实现更高的生产效率，进一步提升行业生产的智能化水平。
一线采访
走进广西柳工机械股份有限公司智能装载机智能工厂装配车间，浓浓的科技气息扑面而来，一辆辆AGV自动运输车往来穿梭、智能立体库有序吞吐零部件、空中EMS输送线高效配送物料……“地下、地面、空中”三位一体的智能物流体系高效运作，未来感十足。
“在下料、分拣、机器人焊接及涂装、柔性化装配、物流等环节均实现了智能化。”柳工装载机智能工厂区域生产高级经理邹广金告诉记者，目前，工厂自动化和智能化设备占比达到85％以上。
“滴滴滴……”记者注意到，工厂内不时会响起一阵提示音。“这意味着又一台装载机成功下线了。”邹广金称，“一台装载机需要通过多个工位完成装配下线，环节很多，但整个流程只需5-10分钟实现。”
高效生产的背后，离不开柳工加快推动5G工厂建设。
5G工厂，顾名思义，是指以5G为代表的数字技术广泛应用于生产现场，形成生产单元广泛连接、数据要素充分利用、创新应用高效赋能的先进工厂。
柳工积极顺应新一轮科技革命，提早谋划部署，目前，装载机智能工厂已实现全场景的“5G+WIFI6”网络覆盖，各场景间的信息壁垒被打破，实现了“人、机、料、法、环”各要素的全面互联。
“通过‘5G+工业互联网’深度融合，工厂在产品模块化、生产柔性化等方面取得显著进展。”邹广金向记者举例，通过5G高速传输，可将不同的整机信息传送到后台进行集中计算和分析，再反馈给机械臂完成动作，实现配件的柔性安装，解决传统生产线在处理不同产品订单时需要停机换线的问题，“让机器拥有类似人类的应变能力，大幅提升生产线的自动化水平和生产效率。”
目前，柳工装载机智能工厂具备日产100台装载机、年产3.1万台装载机的能力。相较于智能工厂投产前，装载机整机质量外反馈率下降50%，制造周期缩短50%。
不只是工厂，柳工正以5G为翼，推动人工智能技术和产业变革，重构工程机械新范式，大模型也早已悄然化身数字员工，学习、参与柳工生产、运营等各个环节。
在产品研发部门，研发人员利用“5G+大数据”提取上万份标书中的产品市场需求；在产品新技术研究所，工程师通过“5G+柳工大模型”设计新产品方案；在产品服务维修现场，柳工数字员工“柳小元”依托“5G+AI”技术，化身维修专家，指导服务人员精准定位故障部位……
“我们希望借助5G和大模型技术，打造柳工工程机械领域大模型，将智能化覆盖到企业运营全价值链环节，以实现产品、制造、服务、运营和客户运维的数字化和智能化。”广西柳工机械股份有限公司全球研发中心数字化研究院常务副院长孙帅表示。
从中国第一台轮式装载机Z435，到全球首台商用5G智能遥控装载机、新一代无人驾驶电动装载机……柳工始终以创新驱动发展，不断开创装载机制造的新高度。2024年，柳工装载机国内市场份额稳居第一，电动装载机全球销量同比增长194%以上。
如今，随着“全面智能化”战略的实施，这家老牌工程机械制造企业正向“智”突围，加快推动制造智能化、产品及施工智能化、营销与服务智能化和智慧管理，从传统设备制造商向智能绿色装备和解决方案提供商转型，为“中国智造”注入新动能。

title: In Mozambico, mentre si aggravano le violenze, le Comunità di Sant'Egidio non rinunciano ad aprire le porte dei pranzi di Natale, luoghi di pace per tanti poveri
text:
Si va aggravando in queste ore la situazione in Mozambico. La proclamazione ufficiale dei risultati delle elezioni ha scatenato un'escalation della violenza: solo nelle ultime ore si calcola siano rimaste uccise più di 20 persone, mentre si susseguono saccheggi e linciaggi. Dopo una rivolta nel carcere di massima sicurezza di Machava (Maputo), circa 1500 detenuti sono fuggiti. Posti di polizia e uffici pubblici vengono assaltati ma anche, in maniera indiscriminata, negozi e case.
In molte città, tra cui Nacala, Moma, e Nampula, non si è potuto celebrare le messe di Natale, per motivi di sicurezza. Sempre a Nampula, fra lunedì e martedì, è stata assaltata una casa di suore brasiliane accanto alla casa del vescovo, saccheggiata la farmacia diocesana e distrutta la casa dei preti. Molte città sono "bloccate": le barricate create dai manifestanti impediscono di uscire ed entrare dalle città principali per via terrestre.
Nonostante l'estrema difficoltà, le Comunità di Sant'Egidio non hanno rinunciato a celebrare il Natale e laddove è stato possibile sono stati fatti i pranzi di Natale: a Maputo, a Beira in 8 luoghi diversi, 7 a Nampula e in molte altre città si sono riuniti in tanti.
Purtroppo in alcuni luoghi non è stato possibile perché anche il 25 dicembre sono continuati i saccheggi e le violenze. Case, negozi e uffici sono stati incendiati. Un responsabile di una comunità di villaggio ha riferito: “Adesso la situazione è calma, ma perché hanno bruciato tutto”.
In molte Comunità si attende che le violenze si calmino per poter riunire i poveri, i bambini delle Scuole della Pace con le loro famiglie e offrire loro uno spazio di serenità e di pace.
Tutte le Comunità di Sant'Egidio, ovunque nel mondo, si uniscono in queste ore nella preghiera affinchè in Mozambico cessino le violenze, torni la calma e si riaprano le vie del dialogo.

author: Rima Najjar
title: Hamas’ “Guests” — Table Manners in Israel vs. Arab Traditional Values: The History of Palestinian Solidarity with Jewish Immigrants
text:
Hamas’ “Guests” — Table Manners in Israel vs. Arab Traditional Values: The History of Palestinian Solidarity with Jewish Immigrants

***
Only a short time prior to listening to Abu Obaidah’s press statement of Dec 21, I had been watching a news report that included a view of the installation of the table set for 200 that was initially organized in Tel Aviv by Mosaic United, the World Zionist Organization and the European Jewish Congress as a symbol of the absent prisoners held by the Palestinian resistance in Gaza. The news report featured an Israeli activist saying, without irony, “because human lives matter.”
What struck me in Abu Obaidah’s statement wasn’t, as you might think, the hypocrisy of such a statement by the activist, a hypocrisy I have come to expect after more than two months of Israeli massacres of Palestinian children and civilians numbered in the thousands. Rather, what struck me was something Abu Obaidah said about a clash of civilizations: “The enemy continues to repeat its foolishness and historical mistakes because it is disconnected from the reality of our people and their civilization.”
The image of the pristine table arrangement in Tel Aviv graphically represents a western settler-colonial reality.
The images of the frenetic scramble for food on top of humanitarian aid trucks by starving Palestinians only increased the grotesqueness of this image below and its associations in my mind.
Installation featuring a table set for 200 in “a pristine Shabbat arrangement” extends across the entire plaza outside the Tel Aviv Museum of Art
In the epic events unfolding horrifically before our eyes in Gaza in ways that often fail words, adherence to tradition and social norms are not confined to interactions with fine china, crystal glasses, and silverware. When the Palestinian resistance called their captives “guests,” anyone familiar with the Arab tradition of hospitality immediately understood what that meant and was not surprised at the testimony of released Israeli captives regarding their good treatment.
Historically, Arab hospitality emerged from the practice of welcoming and providing for desert travelers who passed through towns. The aim was to honor guests and break the ice, eliminating any awkwardness or fear associated with meeting strangers.
Despite hasbara efforts to obscure these facts, it is well documented that Palestinian communities under the British Mandate initially welcomed Jewish immigrants to Palestine, because they recognized their economic contributions and skills.
Palestinian families were hospitable, providing food and shelter to Jewish immigrants who arrived in Palestine with little or no resources, emphasizing a shared humanity. All of this changed when Zionist plans to displace Palestinians and take their land became apparent to a largely agrarian population.
It’s a pity that Zionist invaders in Palestine did not learn from the traditions and values of the land they occupied in 1948, but rather brought with them their own version of Nazi cruelty (the Irgun targeted Palestinian civilians then, just as the “IDF” is targeting them now with much more devastating weapons, even invoking nuclear weapons), thus adopting the colonial values and tactics of their western countries of origin and practicing the same harsh suppression measures introduced by the British in Palestine during the 1936–1939 Palestinian revolt.
Israeli activist: “Because human lives matter …”
The British administration during that time employed various tactics to suppress the Palestinian uprising of 1936–1939. These
repressive measures, often conducted with the help of Jewish forces, were intended to intimidate the entire Palestinian population and undermine popular support for the revolt. If you are following Israel’s war on Gaza and its repression tactics these past decades since its establishment, you will recognize the methods I list below immediately:
Mass detentions of Palestinians (“caging a village”) took place with the aid of Zionist intelligence and helped build a network of informants: “Mass detention of male populations during searches — in on-site or semipermanent cages — became commonplace and was often combined with forced labor and other forms of punishment. The scale of detentions and the broad sweep of the population they affected are one of the most dramatic and underexamined aspects of the 1930s counterinsurgency.”
Another “dramatic” measure was that of extra-judicial executions: By summer 1938, “the British reoccupied villages in the Galilee and the central highlands, put the Special Night Squads — notorious units that placed irregular Jewish forces under British officers to carry out raids and extrajudicial executions — into action, and converted the Mandate judicial system into a hanging court for Arabs.”
There were also house demolitions used as a punitive tactic, heightened surveillance and control over Palestinian communities by British and Jewish policemen, house searches without warning or consent, administrative detentions (beatings and imprisonments without formal charges or trial), night raids disrupting lives and instilling fears, torture, deportation, and land confiscations with the confiscated land sometimes allocated for Jewish colonies or other purposes.
Today, Israel by all accounts is following in the footsteps of the imperial superpower of our time in Iraq. I am referring here to US “counterinsurgency” efforts in Iraq in 2003–2006, when the US struggled to mount an effective plan to protect the civilian population and lacked a coherent strategy, which led to intermittent and ineffective tactical approaches without achieving desired outcomes.
In western culture, knowing how to set a table correctly and understanding the proper use of knives and forks is considered a sign of cultural refinement. Think of Downton Abbey or of the many times in movies a character from a “lower-class” background agonizes over the use of knives and forks when thrown into a posh environment. And think also of the smug assumptions some western cinema goers make upon encountering the heartwarming Arab tradition of arranging the family table on the floor using pita bread or flatbread or the right hand to scoop up bites from a communal dish, where simplicity and communal sharing are given priority over elaborate table settings.
Arab culture is a culture that European Zionist Jews regard as inferior, in keeping with what Edward Said
calls the “dispossessing movements of modern European colonialism.”
The notion that some cultures were advanced and civilized, others backward and uncivilized; these ideas, plus the lasting social meaning imparted to the fact of color (and hence of race) by philosophers like John Locke and David Hume, made it axiomatic by the middle of the nineteenth century that Europeans always ought to rule non-Europeans.
Imperial table manners are just a veneer. A great deal has been made of Queen Victoria’s “quick thinking and uncommon courtesy” during a diplomatic reception in 19th-century England when she drank from a finger bowl in imitation of the action of an African chieftain, who had no idea of its use. With this gesture, she is said to have “spared her guest from humiliation.” Why an African chieftain should feel humiliated for not being familiar with the table etiquette of a finger bowl is not a mystery. The assumption is that the table manners of the empire are naturally more “civilized” than those of the chieftain’s culture.

Rima Najjar is a Palestinian whose father’s side of the family comes from the forcibly depopulated village of Lifta on the western outskirts of Jerusalem and whose mother’s side of the family is from Ijzim, south of Haifa. She is an activist, researcher and retired professor of English literature, Al-Quds University, occupied West Bank.
She is a regular contributor to Global Research.

author: Omar Hernández
title: Policías de Zacatecas liberan a dos mujeres y tres hombres secuestrados en una gasolinera | El Heraldo de México
text: Derivado de un operativo policiaco de la Fuerza de Reacción Inmediata de la Policía Estatal de Zacatecas, se logró ubicar y liberar a cinco personas reportadas como [desaparecidas ](https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/nacional/2023/12/18/familia-ecuatoriana-no-desaparecio-en-zacatecas-su-ultima-ubicacion-se-detecto-en-durango-563721.html)en el municipio de Loreto, confirmaron las autoridades del estado por la tarde de este jueves. La desaparición de las cinco personas se registró en una gasolinera de la comunidad de San Marcos; en total tres hombres y dos mujeres fueron obligados por un [ comando delictivo](https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/nacional/2023/12/11/detienen-presuntos-secuestradores-en-zacatecas-salvan-una-mujer-561839.html) a subir a una camioneta para privarlos ilegalmente de la libertad, cuatro de las víctimas trabajaban en la estación de servicio. Sigue leyendo: [Balean a familia reunida en un funeral en Fresnillo: hay dos personas muertas y cuatro heridos](https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/nacional/2023/12/28/balean-familia-reunida-en-un-funeral-en-fresnillo-hay-dos-personas-muertas-cuatro-heridos-565844.html) [El gobierno de Zacatecas denuncia al de Durango por permitir la operación de una red de secuestradores de migrantes](https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/edicion-impresa/2023/12/20/el-gobierno-de-zacatecas-denuncia-al-de-durango-por-permitir-la-operacion-de-una-red-de-secuestradores-de-migrantes-564230.html) Al recibir el reporte del hecho delictivo, la Fiscalía de Justicia del Estado emitió las cédulas de búsqueda para intentar localizar a Diana, María, Jeffrey, Ricardo y Héctor. También se solicitó el apoyo de la [Secretaría de Seguridad Pública](https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/nacional/2023/12/13/capturan-francisco-n-jefe-de-plaza-del-cjng-en-zacatecas-562590.html), la Coordinación Nacional Antisecuestros, el Ejército y la Guardia Nacional. Ubicados en municipio de Pinos Gracias a los operativos realizados en la región, en el municipio vecino de Pinos se logró ubicar los dos vehículos utilizados para la desaparición de las cinco personas, con el aseguramiento se obtuvieron elementos que permitieron la ubicación donde los agresores tenían retenidas a sus víctimas. Sin dar más detalles sobre la mecánica del operativo de rescate, por encontrarse una investigación en curso, la Fiscalía de Justicia del Estado confirmó mediante el comunicado de prensa 131, la liberación de las dos mujeres y tres hombres, quienes se encuentran en buen estado de salud y a quienes se les brinda asistencia médica, psicológica y legal; fueron trasladados para reunirse con sus familiares y continuar con el protocolo de atención a víctimas. Darán más detalles A través de las redes sociales, Rodrigo Reyes Mugüerza, secretario general de gobierno de Zacatecas adelanto que la Vocería de la mesa de construcción de paz, daría mayores detalles sobre el operativo de rescate, una vez que se reúnan los indicios que buscan dar con los responsables de este hecho delictivo. dhfm

author: Eric Stephen
title: Dodgers win 90 games for the 11th consecutive full season - True Blue LA
text: By beating the Marlins on Wednesday night in Miami, the [Dodgers](https://www.truebluela.com/) have reached 90 wins for the 11th full season in a row, an accomplishment that should be celebrated even amid obviously loftier goals. Yes, this year will be the Dodgers’ worst winning percentage in the regular season since 2018, and unless they win their final 10 games will snap their streak of four consecutive full seasons with 100-plus wins, unprecedented in MLB history. But getting to 90 wins should still be celebrated. Some time soon — [perhaps as early as Thursday by beating the Marlins OR getting losses by both the Braves and Mets](https://www.truebluela.com/2024/9/15/24245175/dodgers-standings-magic-number-division-postseason) — the Dodgers will clinch their 12th consecutive playoff berth, dating back to 2013. To put this run in perspective, the Dodgers have 11 seasons with 90 wins during that span, with only the truncated 2020 campaign falling short. The next-best teams have only six 90-win years during the last dozen years. The Guardians (88-65) will add a seventh season this year, the [Astros](https://www.crawfishboxes.com) might (needing to finish 10-2), and the Cardinals (77-75) won’t get to 90 in 2024. The only other franchise to ever have a longer streak of 90-win seasons is the [Yankees](https://www.pinstripealley.com/), who won at least 92 games a dozen years in a row, every season from 1947-58. That stretch is even more remarkable considering the schedule was only 154 games back then instead of 162. Those Yankees won eight [World Series](https://www.sbnation.com/world-series) during that stretch, including five Fall Classic wins over the Dodgers, but none of those teams ever had to navigate extra postseason rounds either. The Yankees from 1947-58 had a .628 winning percentage, [20 points ahead of the next-best team during that time](https://stathead.com/tiny/DoTtP) (Brooklyn at .608). These Dodgers over the last dozen seasons have a .612 winning percentage, [50 points ahead of the next-best](https://stathead.com/tiny/OrywA) (Yankees at .562). Ninety wins in 162 games is equivalent to 85.56 wins over 154 games, so let’s round that up to 86 wins. The best Dodgers stretch under those conditions was eight straight years in Brooklyn from 1949-56. Other long streaks include the [Cubs](https://www.bleedcubbieblue.com/) having a 10-year stretch of at least at least 86 wins from 1904-13. [Atlanta](https://www.batterypower.com/) won 90-plus games in nine straight full seasons from 1991-2000 (excluding the 1994 strike season, when they were on pace for 97 wins). The [Cardinals](https://www.vivaelbirdos.com/) got to seven straight years of 86 or more wins from 1941-47, Same for the [New York Giants](https://www.mccoveychronicles.com/) from 1919-1925. These Dodgers clearly have bigger goals in mind, first of which is winning the National League West, then winning the World Series. We and they are well aware how disappointing it was to fall flat in the last two NL Division Series after winning in triple digits. But winning 90-plus games is remarkable, especially to do so consistency for such a long stretch. It’s perfectly fine to acknowledge and appreciate that, even as a step along a longer journey.
